eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:NatureOfOperations contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 57.4pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-57.4pt'><b>NOTE</b><b>-</b><b>2. ORGANIZATION AND BUSINESS BACKGROUND</b></p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Innocom Technology Holdings, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148; or &#147;INCM&#148;) was incorporated in the State of Nevada on June 26, 1998. On June 20, 2006, the Company changed its name from &#147;Dolphin Productions, Inc.&#148; to &#147;Innocom Technology Holdings, Inc.&#148;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>We are a shell company with no or nominal operations. We are actively considering various acquisition targets and other business opportunities. We hope to acquire one or more operating businesses or consummate a business opportunity within the next twelve months.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>INCM and its subsidiaries are hereinafter referred to as (the &#147;Company&#148;).</p></us-gaap:NatureOfOperations>

ORGANIZATION AND BUSINESS BACKGROUND</b></p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Innocom Technology Holdings, Inc. (the &#147;Company&#148; or &#147;INCM&#148;) was incorporated in the State of Nevada on June 26, 1998. On June 20, 2006, the Company changed its name from &#147;Dolphin Productions, Inc.&#148; to &#147;Innocom Technology Holdings, Inc.&#148;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>We are a shell company with no or nominal operations. We are actively considering various acquisition targets and other business opportunities. We hope to acquire one or more operating businesses or consummate a business opportunity within the next twelve months.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>INCM and its subsidiaries are hereinafter referred to as (the &#147;Company&#148;).</p>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 57.4pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-57.4pt'><b>NOTE</b><b>-</b><b>3. GOING CONCERN UNCERTAINTIES</b></p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements have been prepared using the going concern basis of accounting, which contemplates the realization of assets and the satisfaction of liabilities in the normal course of business.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>For the period ended March 31, 2017, the Company has experienced a continuous loss of $17,268 with an accumulated deficit of $13,426,597 as of that date. The continuation of the Company as a going concern through March 31, 2017 is dependent upon the continued financial support from its stockholders. Management believes this funding will continue, and is also actively seeking new investors. Management believes the existing stockholders will provide the additional cash to meet the Company&#146;s obligations as they become due, and will allow its planned principal business to commence and assembly the production lines of mobile handsets and components in the PRC.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>These factors raise substantial doubt about the Company&#146;s ability to continue as a going concern. These condensed consolidated financial statements do not include any adjustments to reflect the possible future effects on the recoverability and classification of assets and liabilities that may result in the Company not being able to continue as a going concern.</p></us-gaap:SubstantialDoubtAboutGoingConcernTextBlock>

eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 57.4pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-57.4pt'><b>NOTE</b><b>-</b><b>3. GOING CONCERN UNCERTAINTIES</b></p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements have been prepared using the going concern basis of accounting, which contemplates the realization of assets and the satisfaction of liabilities in the normal course of business.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>For the period ended March 31, 2017, the Company has experienced a continuous loss of $17,268 with an accumulated deficit of $13,426,597 as of that date. The continuation of the Company as a going concern through March 31, 2017 is dependent upon the continued financial support from its stockholders. Management believes this funding will continue, and is also actively seeking new investors. Management believes the existing stockholders will provide the additional cash to meet the Company&#146;s obligations as they become due, and will allow its planned principal business to commence and assembly the production lines of mobile handsets and components in the PRC.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>These factors raise substantial doubt about the Company&#146;s ability to continue as a going concern. These condensed consolidated financial statements do not include any adjustments to reflect the possible future effects on the recoverability and classification of assets and liabilities that may result in the Company not being able to continue as a going concern.</p>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 57.4pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-57.4pt'><b>NOTE</b><b>-</b><b>4. SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</b></p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements reflect the application of certain significant accounting policies as described in this note and elsewhere in the accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements and notes.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 24.1pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-24.1pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Shell company</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company has ceased all of its business and is currently considered as a shell company.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Use of estimates</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>In preparing these condensed consolidated financial statements, management makes estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities in the balance sheets and revenues and expenses during the periods reported. Actual results may differ from these estimates.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Basis of consolidation</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The condensed consolidated financial statements include the financial statements of INCM and its subsidiaries. All significant inter-company balances and transactions within the Company have been eliminated upon consolidation.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Cash and cash equivalents</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Cash and cash equivalents are carried at cost and represent cash on hand, demand deposits placed with banks or other financial institutions and all highly liquid investments with an original maturity of three months or less as of the purchase date of such investments.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Comprehensive income or loss</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>ASC Topic 220,<i> &#147;Comprehensive Income&#148;</i> establishes standards for reporting and display of comprehensive income or loss, its components and accumulated balances. Comprehensive income or loss as defined includes all changes in equity during a period from non-owner sources. Accumulated comprehensive income or loss, as presented in the accompanying consolidated statement of stockholders&#146; deficit consists of changes in unrealized gains and losses on foreign currency translation. This comprehensive income or loss is not included in the computation of income tax expense or benefit.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Income taxes</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company adopts ASC Topic 740 <i>&#147;Income Taxes&#148;</i>, regarding accounting for uncertainty in income taxes which prescribes the recognition threshold and measurement attributes for financial statement recognition and measurement of tax positions taken or expected to be taken on a tax return. In addition, the guidance requires the determination of whether the benefits of tax positions will be more likely than not sustained upon audit based upon the technical merits of the tax position. For tax positions that are determined to be more likely than not sustained upon audit, a company recognizes the largest amount of benefit that is greater than 50% likely of being realized upon ultimate settlement in the financial statements. For tax positions that are not determined to be more likely than not sustained upon audit, a company does not recognize any portion of the benefit in the financial statements. The guidance provides for de-recognition, classification, penalties and interest, accounting in interim periods and disclosure.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company did not have any unrecognized tax positions or benefits and there was no effect on the financial condition or results of operations for the three months ended March 31, 2017. The Company and its subsidiaries are subject to local and various foreign tax jurisdictions. The Company&#146;s tax returns remain open subject to examination by major tax jurisdictions.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Net loss per share</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt -0.55pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company calculates net loss per share in accordance with ASC Topic 260,<i> &#147;Earnings per Share&#148;</i>. Basic loss per share is computed by dividing the net loss by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the period. Diluted loss per share is computed similar to basic loss per share except that the denominator is increased to include the number of additional common shares that would have been outstanding if the potential common stock equivalents had been issued and if the additional common shares were dilutive.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Foreign currencies translation</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Transactions denominated in currencies other than the functional currency are translated into the functional currency at the exchange rates prevailing at the dates of the transaction. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other than the functional currency are translated into the functional currency using the applicable exchange rates at the balance sheet dates. The resulting exchange differences are recorded in the statement of operations.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The reporting currency of the Company is United States Dollars (&#147;US$&#148;). The Company&#146;s subsidiaries operating in Hong Kong and the PRC maintained their books and records in their local currency, Hong Kong Dollars (&#147;HK$&#148;) and Renminbi Yuan (&#147;RMB&#148;), which are functional currencies as being the primary currency of the economic environment in which these entities operate.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>In general, assets and liabilities are translated into US$, in accordance with ASC Topic 830-30, &#147;<i>Translation of Financial Statement&#148;</i>, using the exchange rate on the balance sheet date. Revenues and expenses are translated at average rates prevailing during the period. The gains and losses resulting from translation of financial statements of foreign subsidiaries are recorded as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income within the statement of stockholders&#146; equity.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Translation of amounts from RMB and HK$ into US$1 has been made at the following exchange rates for the respective period:</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Related parties</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Parties, which can be a corporation or individual, are considered to be related if the Company has the ability, directly or indirectly, to control the other party or exercise significant influence over the other party in making financial and operating decisions. Companies are also considered to be related if they are subject to common control or common significant influence.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Fair value of financial instruments</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The carrying value of the Company&#146;s financial instruments: cash and cash equivalents, prepayments and other receivables, accounts payable, amount due to a related party, other payables and accrued liabilities approximate at their fair values because of the short-term nature of these financial instruments. </p> <p align="center" style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:center;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-indent:1.6pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company also follows the guidance of the ASC Topic 820-10, &#147;<i>Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures</i>&#148; (&#147;ASC 820-10&#148;), with respect to financial assets and liabilities that are measured at fair value. ASC 820-10 establishes a three-tier fair value hierarchy that prioritizes the inputs used in measuring fair value as follows: </p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0"> <tr style='height:0.1in'> <td valign="top" width="24" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;width:0.25in;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p></td> <td valign="top" width="578" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;width:433.35pt;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'><i>Level 1 </i>: Observable inputs such as quoted prices in active markets; </p></td></tr></table></div> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style='width:100%'> <tr style='height:0.1in'> <td valign="top" width="24" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;width:0.25in;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p></td> <td valign="top" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'><i>Level 2 </i>: Inputs, other than the quoted prices in active markets, that are observable either directly or indirectly; and </p></td></tr></table></div> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style='width:100%'> <tr style='height:0.1in'> <td valign="top" width="24" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;width:0.25in;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p></td> <td valign="top" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'><i>Level 3 </i>: Unobservable inputs in which there is little or no market data, which require the reporting entity to develop its own assumptions </p></td></tr></table></div> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Fair value estimates are made at a specific point in time based on relevant market information about the financial instrument. These estimates are subjective in nature and involve uncertainties and matters of significant judgment and, therefore, cannot be determined with precision. Changes in assumptions could significantly affect the estimates. </p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Recent accounting pronouncements</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company has reviewed all recently issued, but not yet effective, accounting pronouncements and does not believe the future adoption of any such pronouncements may be expected to cause a material impact on its financial condition or the results of its operations.</p></us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>

eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 57.4pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-57.4pt'><b>NOTE</b><b>-</b><b>4. SUMMARY OF SIGNIFICANT ACCOUNTING POLICIES</b></p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements reflect the application of certain significant accounting policies as described in this note and elsewhere in the accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements and notes.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 24.1pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-24.1pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Shell company</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company has ceased all of its business and is currently considered as a shell company.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Use of estimates</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>In preparing these condensed consolidated financial statements, management makes estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities in the balance sheets and revenues and expenses during the periods reported. Actual results may differ from these estimates.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Basis of consolidation</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The condensed consolidated financial statements include the financial statements of INCM and its subsidiaries. All significant inter-company balances and transactions within the Company have been eliminated upon consolidation.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Cash and cash equivalents</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Cash and cash equivalents are carried at cost and represent cash on hand, demand deposits placed with banks or other financial institutions and all highly liquid investments with an original maturity of three months or less as of the purchase date of such investments.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Comprehensive income or loss</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>ASC Topic 220,<i> &#147;Comprehensive Income&#148;</i> establishes standards for reporting and display of comprehensive income or loss, its components and accumulated balances. Comprehensive income or loss as defined includes all changes in equity during a period from non-owner sources. Accumulated comprehensive income or loss, as presented in the accompanying consolidated statement of stockholders&#146; deficit consists of changes in unrealized gains and losses on foreign currency translation. This comprehensive income or loss is not included in the computation of income tax expense or benefit.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Income taxes</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company adopts ASC Topic 740 <i>&#147;Income Taxes&#148;</i>, regarding accounting for uncertainty in income taxes which prescribes the recognition threshold and measurement attributes for financial statement recognition and measurement of tax positions taken or expected to be taken on a tax return. In addition, the guidance requires the determination of whether the benefits of tax positions will be more likely than not sustained upon audit based upon the technical merits of the tax position. For tax positions that are determined to be more likely than not sustained upon audit, a company recognizes the largest amount of benefit that is greater than 50% likely of being realized upon ultimate settlement in the financial statements. For tax positions that are not determined to be more likely than not sustained upon audit, a company does not recognize any portion of the benefit in the financial statements. The guidance provides for de-recognition, classification, penalties and interest, accounting in interim periods and disclosure.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company did not have any unrecognized tax positions or benefits and there was no effect on the financial condition or results of operations for the three months ended March 31, 2017. The Company and its subsidiaries are subject to local and various foreign tax jurisdictions. The Company&#146;s tax returns remain open subject to examination by major tax jurisdictions.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Net loss per share</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt -0.55pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company calculates net loss per share in accordance with ASC Topic 260,<i> &#147;Earnings per Share&#148;</i>. Basic loss per share is computed by dividing the net loss by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the period. Diluted loss per share is computed similar to basic loss per share except that the denominator is increased to include the number of additional common shares that would have been outstanding if the potential common stock equivalents had been issued and if the additional common shares were dilutive.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Foreign currencies translation</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Transactions denominated in currencies other than the functional currency are translated into the functional currency at the exchange rates prevailing at the dates of the transaction. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other than the functional currency are translated into the functional currency using the applicable exchange rates at the balance sheet dates. The resulting exchange differences are recorded in the statement of operations.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The reporting currency of the Company is United States Dollars (&#147;US$&#148;). The Company&#146;s subsidiaries operating in Hong Kong and the PRC maintained their books and records in their local currency, Hong Kong Dollars (&#147;HK$&#148;) and Renminbi Yuan (&#147;RMB&#148;), which are functional currencies as being the primary currency of the economic environment in which these entities operate.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>In general, assets and liabilities are translated into US$, in accordance with ASC Topic 830-30, &#147;<i>Translation of Financial Statement&#148;</i>, using the exchange rate on the balance sheet date. Revenues and expenses are translated at average rates prevailing during the period. The gains and losses resulting from translation of financial statements of foreign subsidiaries are recorded as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income within the statement of stockholders&#146; equity.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Translation of amounts from RMB and HK$ into US$1 has been made at the following exchange rates for the respective period:</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Related parties</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Parties, which can be a corporation or individual, are considered to be related if the Company has the ability, directly or indirectly, to control the other party or exercise significant influence over the other party in making financial and operating decisions. Companies are also considered to be related if they are subject to common control or common significant influence.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Fair value of financial instruments</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The carrying value of the Company&#146;s financial instruments: cash and cash equivalents, prepayments and other receivables, accounts payable, amount due to a related party, other payables and accrued liabilities approximate at their fair values because of the short-term nature of these financial instruments. </p> <p align="center" style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:center;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-indent:1.6pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company also follows the guidance of the ASC Topic 820-10, &#147;<i>Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures</i>&#148; (&#147;ASC 820-10&#148;), with respect to financial assets and liabilities that are measured at fair value. ASC 820-10 establishes a three-tier fair value hierarchy that prioritizes the inputs used in measuring fair value as follows: </p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0"> <tr style='height:0.1in'> <td valign="top" width="24" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;width:0.25in;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p></td> <td valign="top" width="578" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;width:433.35pt;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'><i>Level 1 </i>: Observable inputs such as quoted prices in active markets; </p></td></tr></table></div> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style='width:100%'> <tr style='height:0.1in'> <td valign="top" width="24" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;width:0.25in;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p></td> <td valign="top" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'><i>Level 2 </i>: Inputs, other than the quoted prices in active markets, that are observable either directly or indirectly; and </p></td></tr></table></div> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style='width:100%'> <tr style='height:0.1in'> <td valign="top" width="24" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;width:0.25in;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p></td> <td valign="top" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'><i>Level 3 </i>: Unobservable inputs in which there is little or no market data, which require the reporting entity to develop its own assumptions </p></td></tr></table></div> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Fair value estimates are made at a specific point in time based on relevant market information about the financial instrument. These estimates are subjective in nature and involve uncertainties and matters of significant judgment and, therefore, cannot be determined with precision. Changes in assumptions could significantly affect the estimates. </p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Recent accounting pronouncements</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company has reviewed all recently issued, but not yet effective, accounting pronouncements and does not believe the future adoption of any such pronouncements may be expected to cause a material impact on its financial condition or the results of its operations.</p>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:ComprehensiveIncomePolicyPolicyTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Comprehensive income or loss</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>ASC Topic 220,<i> &#147;Comprehensive Income&#148;</i> establishes standards for reporting and display of comprehensive income or loss, its components and accumulated balances. Comprehensive income or loss as defined includes all changes in equity during a period from non-owner sources. Accumulated comprehensive income or loss, as presented in the accompanying consolidated statement of stockholders&#146; deficit consists of changes in unrealized gains and losses on foreign currency translation. This comprehensive income or loss is not included in the computation of income tax expense or benefit.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p></us-gaap:ComprehensiveIncomePolicyPolicyTextBlock>
eleList.name: ComprehensiveIncomePolicyPolicyTextBlock
eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Comprehensive income or loss</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>ASC Topic 220,<i> &#147;Comprehensive Income&#148;</i> establishes standards for reporting and display of comprehensive income or loss, its components and accumulated balances. Comprehensive income or loss as defined includes all changes in equity during a period from non-owner sources. Accumulated comprehensive income or loss, as presented in the accompanying consolidated statement of stockholders&#146; deficit consists of changes in unrealized gains and losses on foreign currency translation. This comprehensive income or loss is not included in the computation of income tax expense or benefit.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Income taxes</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company adopts ASC Topic 740 <i>&#147;Income Taxes&#148;</i>, regarding accounting for uncertainty in income taxes which prescribes the recognition threshold and measurement attributes for financial statement recognition and measurement of tax positions taken or expected to be taken on a tax return. In addition, the guidance requires the determination of whether the benefits of tax positions will be more likely than not sustained upon audit based upon the technical merits of the tax position. For tax positions that are determined to be more likely than not sustained upon audit, a company recognizes the largest amount of benefit that is greater than 50% likely of being realized upon ultimate settlement in the financial statements. For tax positions that are not determined to be more likely than not sustained upon audit, a company does not recognize any portion of the benefit in the financial statements. The guidance provides for de-recognition, classification, penalties and interest, accounting in interim periods and disclosure.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company did not have any unrecognized tax positions or benefits and there was no effect on the financial condition or results of operations for the three months ended March 31, 2017. The Company and its subsidiaries are subject to local and various foreign tax jurisdictions. The Company&#146;s tax returns remain open subject to examination by major tax jurisdictions.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p></us-gaap:IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock>
eleList.name: IncomeTaxPolicyTextBlock

In addition, the guidance requires the determination of whether the benefits of tax positions will be more likely than not sustained upon audit based upon the technical merits of the tax position. For tax positions that are determined to be more likely than not sustained upon audit, a company recognizes the largest amount of benefit that is greater than 50% likely of being realized upon ultimate settlement in the financial statements. For tax positions that are not determined to be more likely than not sustained upon audit, a company does not recognize any portion of the benefit in the financial statements. The guidance provides for de-recognition, classification, penalties and interest, accounting in interim periods and disclosure.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company did not have any unrecognized tax positions or benefits and there was no effect on the financial condition or results of operations for the three months ended March 31, 2017. The Company and its subsidiaries are subject to local and various foreign tax jurisdictions. The Company&#146;s tax returns remain open subject to examination by major tax jurisdictions.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Net loss per share</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt -0.55pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company calculates net loss per share in accordance with ASC Topic 260,<i> &#147;Earnings per Share&#148;</i>. Basic loss per share is computed by dividing the net loss by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the period. Diluted loss per share is computed similar to basic loss per share except that the denominator is increased to include the number of additional common shares that would have been outstanding if the potential common stock equivalents had been issued and if the additional common shares were dilutive.</p></us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock>
eleList.name: EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock
eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Net loss per share</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt -0.55pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company calculates net loss per share in accordance with ASC Topic 260,<i> &#147;Earnings per Share&#148;</i>. Basic loss per share is computed by dividing the net loss by the weighted-average number of common shares outstanding during the period. Diluted loss per share is computed similar to basic loss per share except that the denominator is increased to include the number of additional common shares that would have been outstanding if the potential common stock equivalents had been issued and if the additional common shares were dilutive.</p>

eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:ForeignCurrencyTransactionsAndTranslationsPolicyTextBlock contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Foreign currencies translation</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Transactions denominated in currencies other than the functional currency are translated into the functional currency at the exchange rates prevailing at the dates of the transaction. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other than the functional currency are translated into the functional currency using the applicable exchange rates at the balance sheet dates. The resulting exchange differences are recorded in the statement of operations.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The reporting currency of the Company is United States Dollars (&#147;US$&#148;). The Company&#146;s subsidiaries operating in Hong Kong and the PRC maintained their books and records in their local currency, Hong Kong Dollars (&#147;HK$&#148;) and Renminbi Yuan (&#147;RMB&#148;), which are functional currencies as being the primary currency of the economic environment in which these entities operate.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>In general, assets and liabilities are translated into US$, in accordance with ASC Topic 830-30, &#147;<i>Translation of Financial Statement&#148;</i>, using the exchange rate on the balance sheet date. Revenues and expenses are translated at average rates prevailing during the period. The gains and losses resulting from translation of financial statements of foreign subsidiaries are recorded as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income within the statement of stockholders&#146; equity.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p eleList.value: <!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Foreign currencies translation</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>Transactions denominated in currencies other than the functional currency are translated into the functional currency at the exchange rates prevailing at the dates of the transaction. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other than the functional currency are translated into the functional currency using the applicable exchange rates at the balance sheet dates. The resulting exchange differences are recorded in the statement of operations.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The reporting currency of the Company is United States Dollars (&#147;US$&#148;). The Company&#146;s subsidiaries operating in Hong Kong and the PRC maintained their books and records in their local currency, Hong Kong Dollars (&#147;HK$&#148;) and Renminbi Yuan (&#147;RMB&#148;), which are functional currencies as being the primary currency of the economic environment in which these entities operate.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>In general, assets and liabilities are translated into US$, in accordance with ASC Topic 830-30, &#147;<i>Translation of Financial Statement&#148;</i>, using the exchange rate on the balance sheet date. Revenues and expenses are translated at average rates prevailing during the period. The gains and losses resulting from translation of financial statements of foreign subsidiaries are recorded as a separate component of accumulated other comprehensive income within the statement of stockholders&#146; equity.</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p eleList.xmlLine: <us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy contextRef='Y17Q1'><!--egx--><p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt 27pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph;text-indent:-27pt'><font style='font-family:Wingdings'>l&nbsp;&nbsp; </font>Fair value of financial instruments</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The carrying value of the Company&#146;s financial instruments: cash and cash equivalents, prepayments and other receivables, accounts payable, amount due to a related party, other payables and accrued liabilities approximate at their fair values because of the short-term nature of these financial instruments. </p> <p align="center" style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:center;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-indent:1.6pt'>&nbsp;</p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>The Company also follows the guidance of the ASC Topic 820-10, &#147;<i>Fair Value Measurements and Disclosures</i>&#148; (&#147;ASC 820-10&#148;), with respect to financial assets and liabilities that are measured at fair value. ASC 820-10 establishes a three-tier fair value hierarchy that prioritizes the inputs used in measuring fair value as follows: </p> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;text-align:justify;margin:0in 0in 0pt;text-justify:inter-ideograph'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0"> <tr style='height:0.1in'> <td valign="top" width="24" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;width:0.25in;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p></td> <td valign="top" width="578" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;width:433.35pt;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'><i>Level 1 </i>: Observable inputs such as quoted prices in active markets; </p></td></tr></table></div> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p> <div align="center"> <table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" width="100%" border="0" style='width:100%'> <tr style='height:0.1in'> <td valign="top" width="24" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;width:0.25in;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'>&nbsp;</p></td> <td valign="top" style='border-top:#f0f0f0;height:0.1in;border-right:#f0f0f0;border-bottom:#f0f0f0;padding-bottom:0in;padding-top:0in;padding-left:0in;border-left:#f0f0f0;padding-right:0in;background-color:transparent'> <p style='layout-grid-mode:char;margin:0in 0in 0pt'><i>Level 2 </i>: Inputs, other than the quoted prices in active markets, that are observable either directly or indirectly;
